Recap: Jonathan leaves to meet with a liquor distributor and Sandy shows up at Outskirts. Tammy tells him that she wants him to leave her alone and he threatens Jonathan. Jonathan runs into Cassie and Jeffrey at Company and tells them about Sandy. Cassie just tells Jonathan that it is yet another reason why he is bad for Tammy but Jonathan points out that Jeffrey has done pretty much all the same things he did. Jeffrey wants to know why she can think about forgiving him when she can't forgive Jonathan. Tammy shows up at Company and ask for Cassie and Jeffrey's help with Sandy. Sandy later shows up in the backseat of Jonathan's car and plays with his mind. Although at first she plays along, Beth informs Alan that she is not Lorelei and doesn't need her to get what she wants anymore. Beth tells Gus that the reason she did all of this was that on the day he was released Alan left her divorce papers on her bedside table. She also tells Gus that the thinks that Alan-Michael is in on something with his father since when he came back to town is when Alan started changing with her. Gus tells her that her problems with Alan don't have anything to do with him, but she hits him on his leg and reminds him about how he and Harley tricked her and threw her out of the company. She leaves the room and comes back with champagne and a birthday cake for Gus. Alan and Gus try to drug Beth but she turns it around on them and Alan realizes that she drugged the champagne. Beth leaves again and Alan is able to untie Gus before he passes out. Harley and Mallet wind up making a drug bust posing as a married couple, but when they go to sign the papers, Harley realizes the date. She goes to the site of the limo crash and wishes Gus a Happy Birthday. Mallet shows up with her and as they are leaving, see a person coming out of a house in the distance. Harley gasps that it is Gus.
Transcript: Alan: It's so nice to see you again, Lorelei.
Gus: Oh, yeah, Lorelei, her uh... little inner friend there, yeah.
Alan: Yes. Yes, Lorelei used to come out whenever Beth needs to feel strong. And this is definitely one of those times, isn't it?
Beth: ( With southern accent ) Oh, dang, Alan, honey. You caught me. I can't believe...
Alan: Ow!
Beth: It's Beth, Alan! Not Lorelei. Beth! And I'm sorry to say it, but this is exactly why I have to teach you a lesson.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: And done. And you said I couldn't study in a bar. So there.
Jonathan: I'm the one that's having trouble working.
Tammy: Isn't there someplace you're supposed to be right now?
Jonathan: Nope.
Tammy: Yes there is. You're supposed to meet with a liquor distributor.
Jonathan: I can wait.
Tammy: Jonathan, you don't have to guard me 24/7. I set Sandy straight; he's not going to bug me anymore.
Jonathan: Whatever. I'm not going anywhere, so...
Tammy: Go, please.
Jonathan: All right, Farrah.
Tammy: ( Laughs )
Jonathan: I'll be right back; don't go anywhere.
Sandy: I hear Dr. Beck's intern is going to be a killer.
Tammy: Sandy, what are you doing here?
Sandy: I thought we'd cram together, you know. If we go through the notes together, we'd team up--
Tammy: No. No.
Sandy: Why not? You do want to ace the exam, don't you?
Tammy: Are you trying to get yourself killed?
Sandy: Nice to see you have such faith in your boyfriend.

Jeffrey: Hi.
Cassie: Hi.

Cassie: Okay.
Jeffrey: Please. So, how was your day?
Cassie: Fine.
Jeffrey: Did you meet with R.J.'s teachers?
Cassie: Is this what we do now, small talk?
Jeffrey: Well, uh... the big stuff hasn't been going so well.
Cassie: You lied to me, Jeffrey, about one too many things. It's not something I can get over just like that.
Jeffrey: I know. I'm just glad you came. ( Door shuts ) ( cell phone rings )
Jonathan: Hello? Yeah. You couldn't tell me this sooner? No, no, I'm not rescheduling. You just lost an account. Hey, guys. How's it going? Can I buy you guys dinner?

Mallet: Hi, Dan.
Dan: Hi, how are you? Nice to meet you.
Cara: So, what's the occasion. You're buying drinks for perfect strangers?

Harley: Hey. ( Laughs ) Such a romantic. This ball and chain of mine.

Beth: You know, something, if this weren't so insulting, it would be funny. I finally stand up for myself. I finally fight for something I believe in and you think that must mean I'm another person. Well, news flash for you Alan: I don't need Lorelei to fight my battles for me anymore. I don't need her to save your injured butts! And I sure as hell don't need her to decide what's best for me and my children.
Alan: No, you don't. No, you don't, Beth and I apologize. But please, please don't hit me again.

Beth: Well, now, that is something, isn't it? We both know how hard it is for you to admit that you're wrong. But I'm going to tell you something, Alan, you better start treating me with a little more respect, because if you don't, you're going to wish it really was Lorelei in this room with you. Well, I don't know about you two, but I'm starving. What shall we have for dinner, hmm?

Beth: Oh, why not?

Beth: It's a wonderful example of how you reward loyalty. You see, Gus, the night that Alan was released, when he didn't come home, Alexandra and I were very worried. And of course, I had the tracking device, but I couldn't use it with Alexandra there. So I went up to my bedroom to be alone, and guess what I found waiting for me on my bedside table?
Alan: Beth.
Beth: A letter from my loving husband serving me with a divorce. Do you have any idea what I had to give up to marry you? My daughter, my soul!
Alan: Beth, please calm down. You're being dramatic.

Gus: ( Groans )
Beth: Sh-sh-sh-sh-sh-sh. Be quiet.

Harley: I beg your pardon?

Mallet: It's pretty obvious that we need help. It's pretty obvious to you guys that we need help, all right. Our love life sucks. It's just like... nothing. So it is no great secret. You know, I used to kiss her and she would just melt.

Michael Dempsey, "Inside The Light." I can be serious like Alan-Michael. How am I not like Alan-Michael? I didn't grow up with a trust fund. I got to take it all off. I got my first one in California. Okay, just one. I got that in Ireland. See Alan-Michael Wednesday, March 1, "Inside The Light".

Oh, by the way, thanks for telling Zach that all the crayons had a different flavor. Anyway, seeing them work on the cards with the hearts and the "I love you's," was too much, it almost killed me, so I blocked it out. Until today, when I saw that date on that arrest report. Anyway, this is for you. I know you'd rather have beer and pizza. Anyway... I decided, I'm going to build the house. I think it's a good idea. I'm going to live there with the kids. And... and before you hear it from somebody else, I've gone back on the force. And you'll never guess in a million years who my partner is. You guessed. It's Mallet. I know you'd love that. He's a really good guy. So... this is the most pathetic excuse for a birthday party ever. Happy birthday, baby. You deserve more. You deserve so much more.

Gus: Even if I have to crawl to Springfield on my hands and knees, I'm coming home to you, baby.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: Cassie, when Edmund kidnapped you, I would have done anything, and I mean anything, to save you. The same thing is true with you and Tammy. If you felt that somebody is hurting her...
Cassie: Well, someone is hurting her. Okay, fine, I get your point.
Jeffrey: Tammy, did anyone else hear him make those threats?
Tammy: No.
Jeffrey: It doesn't matter, I can still get a restraining order put out against the guy.
Tammy: You can?
Jeffrey: Yes.
Tammy: Thank you. Oh, that would be great.
Cassie: Sweetie, I'm so sorry it has come to this.
Tammy: So you believe me?
Cassie: Well, of course, I believe you. I'm so glad you came to me. To us. We'll make sure that Sandy stays away from you.
Tammy: It's not me I'm worried about. It's Jonathan.
Cassie: What I'm saying is we are on your side. You can lean on us, and we'll get through this together, as a family.
Tammy: Thank you. I feel so much better now. I just don't want anyone to get hurt.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Train horn sounds )
Jonathan: This is nuts! You wouldn't want to die, too.

Sandy: What if I got to lose? You just finished telling me I am pathetic. At least this way Tammy gets to miss us both. But she will be wracked with guilt, poor girl. What do you want to do? Do you want to run into that train? Do you want to go into the garage? You want to wreck into the wall, or maybe just... ( car screeches )
Jonathan: You stupid, lying son-of-a...
Sandy: See you soon!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: There you go, in case you get thirsty. Happy birthday. I love you and I miss you. I'll follow you back to the station, okay.
Mallet: Okay. You're on.
Harley: What is that? Is that..?
Mallet: What?
Harley: What is that thing moving in the woods over there?
Mallet: I don't know. It's probably a possum or a raccoon.
Harley: It's too big. Is that coming towards us?
Mallet: Yeah, I think so.
Harley: Mallet, that's a person. Oh, my God. Gus?
[NEXT_ON]
Olivia: Hold on, I don't know where this is going to lead with Frank.
Buzz: We both know where you want to go. You want to go to casual sex land. I care about her, Frank.
Frank: If you care about her the way you say you do, don't try to contact her or e-mail her, don't even contact her while she's still in California.
